item.title: YouTube rolls out an AI playlist generator for Premium users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: YouTube Music is rolling out a new AI-powered playlist-generation feature that allows Premium users on iOS and Android to use text prompts to create playlists.

item.title: The first signs of burnout are coming from the people who embrace AI the most
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Because employees could do more, work began bleeding into lunch breaks and late evenings. The employees' to-do lists expanded to fill every hour that AI freed up, and then kept going.

item.title: Tem raises $75M to remake electricity markets using AI
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Tem has built a transaction engine that relies on AI to cut costs. Lightspeed led the round to help the startup expand to the U.S. and Australia.

item.title: India makes Aadhaar more ubiquitous, but critics say security and privacy concerns remain
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India's Aadhaar is moving into wallets, hotels and policing through a new app. Critics say that amid the broader Aadhaar rollout, it's unclear how data shared through the new app would prevent breaches or leaks.

item.title: Waymo is testing driverless robotaxis in Nashville
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: This is the typical next step before it launches a commercial service.

item.title: MrBeast’s company buys Gen Z-focused fintech app Step
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: YouTube megastar MrBeast announced on Monday that his company, Beast Industries, is buying Step, a teen-focused banking app.

item.title: Bluesky finally adds drafts
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move comes as Bluesky’s competitors, X and Threads, have long supported drafts.

item.title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

item.title: Anthropic’s India expansion collides with a local company that already had the name
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India's Anthropic Software has taken the U.S. AI giant to court over a name dispute.

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out ads
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: OpenAI faced a backlash late last year when it tested app suggestions that looked like unwanted ads. Still, the AI company needs to generate revenue from its popular chatbot to cover the costs of developing its technology and growing the business.

item.title: Lidar-maker Ouster buys vision company StereoLabs as sensor consolidation continues
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Ouster is paying $35 million along with 1.8 million shares.

item.title: So, what’s going on with Musicboard?
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Is Musicboard shutting down? Company says no, but users are worried.

item.title: Harvey reportedly raising at $11B valuation just months after it hit $8B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: After announcing $190 million in ARR in December, Harvey may be raising again.

item.title: Workday CEO Eschenbach departs, with co-founder Aneel Bhusri returning as CEO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Bhusri said in a statement that the company's next chapter would be focused on AI.

item.title: Lyft opens its ride-hailing app to teens
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The new Lyft service comes with a number of guardrails. Only a parent or guardian can create a teen account and drivers who are matched with these underage passengers must meet additional criteria and pass yearly background checks.

item.title: Hacked, leaked, exposed: Why you should never use stalkerware apps
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: According to TechCrunch’s ongoing tally, including the most recent data spill involving uMobix, there have been at least 27 stalkerware companies since 2017 that are known to have been hacked, or leaked customer and victims’ data online.

item.title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: The company raised $13 billion in equity funding just five months ago, but intense competition between frontier labs and the ongoing cost of compute have made them eager to raise as quickly as possible.

item.title: Ex-Googlers are building infrastructure to help companies understand their video data
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Founded by former Google Japan leaders, InfiniMind is building enterprise AI to turn vast, unused video archives into searchable, actionable business intelligence.

item.title: Snapchat now lets you inform others when you have arrived at your destination
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: With its new "Arrival Notifications," users can now set one-time or recurring alerts for locations beyond their home, providing an automatic way to share when they’ve arrived at their destination.

item.title: Hacktivist scrapes over 500,000 stalkerware customers’ payment records
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker, Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: More than half-a-million people who bought access to phone surveillance and social media snooping apps had their email address and partial payment card numbers published online.
